channel.title: Community - Source Institute
channel.description: Topics in the 'Community' category Where we discuss whatever we find interesting and useful. The world of Source Institute, peer to peer education and technology around the world.

item.title: Decentralising connectivity
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Brokering individual connections between learners and experts is hard work, involving trial and error, and speculative exploration.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/decentralising/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Decentralising connectivity

item.title: Towards self-direction
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

A lot more becomes possible when learners are motivated and self-directed, but how do we help them get there? It's a combination of initiating their agency, inspiring them to take a bit of control, then bit by bit, starting to respond to their control.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/self-directing/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Towards self-direction

item.description:
@forum wrote:

Matt Wainright became known in The Africa Prize for raising millions of dollars in investment, but when it came to closing deals with customers he needed help.

item.title: First Steps
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Applying peer learning is usually straight-forward and practical, but picking a first step that will actually make a difference requires a bit of self-evaluation.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/first-steps/

Participants: 1

item.title: Flip your conference into an unconference
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Conferences these days are a hard sell. There are so many of them, and there’s so little to distinguish yourself by. Usually the conference with the bigger budgets win, because they bring in the bigger names.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/flip-your-conference-into-an-unconference/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Flip your conference into an unconference

item.title: Farmhack uses small group projects to spark new possibilities.
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Hackathons are volunteer-driven technology building gatherings usually between 30 to 200 strangers gathering around a certain technology or social problem. Teams form around project ideas, and build them in a day or so. It's a race against the clock to find an idea, make prototype and to demonstrate it at the end of the event. There's usually a judging panel who award a prize.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/farmhack-small-group-projects/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Farmhack uses small group projects to spark new possibilities.

item.description:

Let’s start with how Uber handled January’s sharp drop in Nigeria’s Naira following the drop in crude oil prices:

Henri Nyakarundi is the founder of ARED, a solar kiosk platform used for product distribution network in rural and urban areas in East Africa.

item.title: Harvard defines success by what the learner becomes
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Premeds are not very kind to physicists. Physics is a requirement for med school, and it's treated with a bit of dread, but mostly indignation. Eric Mazur knew that, but accepted the challenge when he started teaching at Harvard.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/learning-from-your-peers/

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Harvard defines success by what the learner becomes

item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Early this year I kicked-off a project to design, and implement a Startup in Residence program for the provincial government of North Holland, under project leadership of the excellent Robbert van Geldrop of Firmhouse.

item.title: Agriculture: an origin of peer education techniques
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Agriculture has been a proving ground for peer learning for quite some time. Peer learning has been used as a supplementary method to education from formal extension education. This track record has generated a rich source of data, and some neat research on what works and how.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/farmer-field-schools/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Agriculture: an origin of peer education techniques

item.title: Santosha Yoga's retreat keeps its schedule flexible
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Nina Sotirova is sitting on a quiet beach in on the island of Lemnos, Greece. She runs Santosha Yoga, a yoga studio in Sofia, Bulgaria. And each summer, she hosts four, week-long retreats in Lemnos.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/santosha-yoga/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Santosha Yoga's retreat keeps its schedule flexible

item.title: Y Combinator puts the learner in control
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Startups are one of the best places to observe new knowledge being put to use. On top of figuring out a new product and how to sell it to a new market, startup founders face the pressure of growing quickly, often needing to raise investment money in order to accelerate their spending, while the threat of bankruptcy is always around the corner.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/putting-learners-in-control/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Y Combinator puts the learner in control

item.title: Evaluating "CoachingOurselves"; a format for peer-to-peer leadership development.
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

When Philip Lenir was ready for a turn in his career away from speech recognition programming, he got interested in management education. His eye fell on Henry Mintzberg’s IMPM (International Master’s Program for Managers) program at McGill University. It was an international program, designed for senior managers, and the education was based on reflective learning in management practice.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/coachingourselves/

Posts: 2

Participants: 2

Read full topic
item.source: Evaluating "CoachingOurselves"; a format for peer-to-peer leadership development.

item.title: IMPM challenged the Harvard case study methodology to develop critical thinking
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

We say ‘worldly’ instead of ‘global’ because ‘global” implies one size fits all and we want the students to really appreciate the importance of cultural differences.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/critical-thinking/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: IMPM challenged the Harvard case study methodology to develop critical thinking

item.title: Grid Facilitation
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

The planning grid at an unconference is the centre of the event. The grid is where people present themselves to the community. It is also something participants come back to regularly, to check their schedules, or to change their selection. All coordination for the day is channeled through the grid.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/grid-facilitation/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Grid Facilitation

item.title: The Santa Fe Institute bet on its unlikely advantages
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Right before the kick-off of the Second World War, two German chemists - Otto Hahn and Fritz Strassman - discovered nuclear fission. Albert Einstein was amongst the scientists that warned U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt that Germany could now develop "extremely strong bombs, of a new type".

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/unlikely-advantages/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: The Santa Fe Institute bet on its unlikely advantages

item.title: What is Peer Learning?
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

When it comes to getting education right in topics and places where the standard stuff just doesn’t work, Peer Learning has been the answer for us.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/what-is-peer-learning/

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: What is Peer Learning?

item.title: Peer retrospectives help people grow at Studio D
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

For Jan Chipchase to do his job, he has had to carry chunks of gold into markets in Myanmar, borrow money from loan sharks in Malaysia, meet taxi drivers in Rio's favellas, and hang out in gun markets in Kabul.

item.title: The UN FAO puts the learner in a fitting environment
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

Halfway down the coastal train line between Chennai and Kolkata, there’s little inland village called Annavaram. From the train station, the village is towards the mountain ridge with the single, white temple on it. As you make your way to the top, you’ll see the Pampa Resevoir on one side, and if you turn back, you can see towards the Indian Ocean, ten kilometres away.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at https://peerlearning.is/outside-of-the-classroom/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: The UN FAO puts the learner in a fitting environment

item.title: Hip Hop Communities as a Model for Education
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

What is education? We mostly associate it with systematic instruction. Showing and telling people how it’s done. But is that all there is to education? No. There’s also a deeper part, that part of knowing why, discovering what your reason is to appropriate these systematic handlings.

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/hip-hop-communities-as-a-model-for-education/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Hip Hop Communities as a Model for Education

item.title: Who is your Peer?
item.dc:creator: @forum
item.description:
@forum wrote:

The term "peers" is commonly used with reference to a group of learners of the same knowledge level and/or discipline. Doctors helping doctors. Writers giving feedback to writers. This gives the impression that peer interaction is limited to where people with similar backgrounds connect (specific status, age, ability, qualification, etc.).

This is a companion discussion topic for the original entry at http://peerlearning.is/who-is-your-peer/

Posts: 1

Participants: 1

Read full topic
item.source: Who is your Peer?
